comment.author: 61361160@N00
comment._content: This image has been featured on Indicommons.org as among the Best of the Commons.

comment.author: 36988215@N08
comment._content: Little did this lady realise I am sure, that her newspaper insulation, furniture and quilts would so perfectly frame her in history as a statement of her 'time'. A perfect sociological photo.

comment.author: 32395958@N04
comment._content: I remember being in the "cabin" on the edge of the "colored quarters" our small Louisiana town of our then housekeeper & babysitter, Mary & her husband George Jackson.  (Mary was from Georgia, coudn't read/write) say around 1950, I was four.  They had one large room, two beds with quilts, newspaper on walls just as in this photo.  I remember going there at Christmas, we did every year with a box of groceries and gifts, it was cold and they had a wood burning iron stove in the middle of the room with a stovepipe up through the ceiling.  I'll never forget that couple and their kind regard toward us.

comment.author: 24793676@N05
comment._content: amaizing how they made all the beautiful quilts that have survived to this day.....
